text: Awa Dioum-Ndiaye (also spelled N'Diaye; born 21 November 1961) is a retired track and field athlete from Senegal who competed in the hurdling, high jump and the heptathlon events during her career in the 1980s. She is best known for winning the gold medal in the women's high jump contest at the 1987 All- Africa Games. She was twice winner at the African Championships in Athletics, winning in 1984 and 1985—the first athlete to win it twice. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1984 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Rabat, Morocco |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |100 m hurdles |14.40 |- |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |High jump |1.76 m |- |1985 |African Championships |Cairo, Egypt |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |High jump |1.76 m |- |1987 |All-Africa Games |Nairobi, Kenya |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |High jump |1.80 m |- |1992 |African Championships |Belle Vue Maurel, Mauritius |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |Triple jump |12.47 m |- !colspan="6"|Representing 20px Africa |- |1985 |IAAF World Cup |Canberra, Australia |align="center" | 8th |High jump |1.70 m |- |} ==References== * Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Senegalese female hurdlers Category:Senegalese female high jumpers Category:Senegalese heptathletes Category:Heptathletes Category:Senegalese female athletes Category:African Games gold medalists for Senegal Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1987 All-Africa Games
title: Awa Dioum-Ndiaye
